briefTitle: Secukinumab in Tumor Necrosis Factor (TNF) - Inadequate Response (IR) Psoriasis Participants.
officialTitle: Secukinumab In Patients With Moderate to Severe Active, Chronic Plaque Psoriasis Who Have Failed on TNFα antaGoNists: A Clinical Trial EvalUating Treatment REsults
summary: This study was designed to prove and quantify the hypothesis that secukinumab is effective, safe and well tolerated in the treatment of moderate to severe chronic plaque-type psoriasis in patients who are inadequate responders to anti-TNFα therapy in a United Kingdom (UK) and Republic of Ireland) specific population.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Secukinumab 300 mg Participants Achieving PASI 75 at 16 Weeks
